list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He scanned the horizon for any sign of a ship.

list_definition.definition: to look at quickly but not in detail

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She scanned the newspaper for news of the murder.

list_definition.definition: to pass radar beams etc over

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The area was scanned for signs of enemy aircraft.

list_definition.definition: to pass an electronic or laser beam over a text or picture in order to store it in the memory of a computer.
to examine and get an image of what is inside a person’s body or an object by using ultra-sound and x-ray

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They scanned his luggage at the airport to see if he was carrying drugs.

list_definition.mean_english: phân tích vần luật của câu thơ
list_definition.definition: to fit into a particular rhythm or metre/meter

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The second line of that verse doesn’t scan properly.
She had an ultrasound scan to see whether the baby was a boy or a girl
a quick scan through the report.
